Adult male.description: Adult male Eastern Bluebirds are darker blue overall with a rusty-orange breast unlike the entirely sky-blue adult male Mountain Bluebirds.

Adult female.description: Adult female Eastern Bluebirds have orange on the chest that is always richer and brighter than even the warmest-chested female Mountain Bluebird.

Adult male.description: Adult male Western Bluebirds are darker blue overall with a rusty-orange breast unlike the entirely sky-blue adult male Mountain Bluebirds.

Female/immature.description: Female/immature Western Bluebirds have a grayish chin whereas female/immature Mountain Bluebirds tend to have a buffy chin. They also lack the white edging on the flight feathers seen on female Mountain Bluebirds.

Adult.description: Townsend's Solitaires have a more prominent white eyering than female Mountain Bluebirds and have buffy coloring on the wings while Mountain Bluebirds have blue tinted wings.
